title: Nova Sintra
text:
Nova Sintra is a city in the central part of the island of <a href="Brava%2C%20Cape%20Verde">Brava</a> in southwestern <a href="Cape%20Verde">Cape Verde</a>. It serves as the seat of the <a href="Brava%2C%20Cape%20Verde">Brava Municipality</a>. The settlement is named after <a href="Sintra">Sintra</a>, the summer residence of the Portuguese kings. Its population is about 1,500. Its elevation is around 500 meters. Since 2010, Nova Sintra has been a city. Agriculture is the predominant source of income on Brava. Tourism is less developed, but there are a few small hotels and guest houses. The "aluguer" buses to the other villages start from "Praça Eugénio Tavares".
The historic center has been submitted to the tentative list of UNESCO's <a href="World%20Heritage%20Site">World Heritage Site</a>s in 2016.
Geography.
Nearby places include the port of <a href="Furna%2C%20Cape%20Verde">Furna</a> to the northeast, <a href="Santa%20B%C3%A1rbara%2C%20Cape%20Verde">Santa Bárbara</a> and <a href="Vinagre">Vinagre</a> to the east, <a href="Jo%C3%A3o%20da%20Noly">João da Noly</a> to the south and <a href="Nossa%20Senhora%20do%20Monte%2C%20Cape%20Verde">Nossa Senhora do Monte</a> to the southwest.
Climate.
Nova Sintra has a desert climate and is cooler than the low-lying areas of the island. Its average rainfall is , and its average temperature is . The coldest month is February with an average of and the warmest is September with an average of .
